p: One recent Canadian study revealed that the mean costs associated with influenza-related hospitalizations ($14,612 CAD) and ICU admissions ($39,477 CAD) are much higher than previously estimated [104]. Beyond reducing outcomes and their associated costs from third-party payer and societal perspectives, significant decreases in healthcare utilization are possible through vaccination [105]. For example, individuals with influenza are frequently prescribed antibiotics, either for bacterial co-infections or sometimes inappropriately, which contribute to antibiotic resistance [106]. Hence, by preventing illness, influenza vaccination likely reduces antibiotic use and the threat of new resistant microbes [107].
